Reviews.Title: “It says it's a 4* its actually worse than Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: estranero
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy (I guess) as you had to fill in a form whilst the receptionist was half interested in what you were asking and half interested in browsing the internet. I asked for a wake up call for 6am - as a backup to my own alarms and it never came. My alarm woke me up at 5:45, and the receptionist claimed to give me a wake up call 10 minutes before the actual time I asked for a wake up call - which was actually a lie. She then tried to convince me that i'd answered the call saying i'm already awake, and then she came to check on me at 6am to see if I was awake - none of this happened. I don't think the receptionist knew what a wake up call was to be honest. I don't even think my phone was working either. Just blatant lying going on there, and she wasn't even at reception in the morning - I had to phone her in her room and she couldn't be bothered to check me out of my room. Room was a bit cramped, and on the 4th floor - a bit of a nightmare as I had bags too. No offer to help me up the stairs either. Note - there is no lift, and the stairways and corridors are narrow. Space mattress on really low bed was actually quite uncomfortable somehow. TV was ok, it worked at least. It didn't have a good range of channels though - 1-3 UK channels and the rest were foreign. Real mish mash of stuff. There was no offer of free wifi - i'd at least expect that in a 4*. Not even a mention if any wifi was available. Flooring on 4th floor looked like it had been done recently, and doesnt match the carpet of the other floors, so I was woken up in the middle of the night by people arriving and all I could hear were footsteps on the wooden floor. Bathroom came with soaps and shampoo which were a welcome surprise. When I asked for a taxi to be booked, receptionist quickly stopped me mid sentence with how much cheaper their taxi's were compared to getting a black cab and offered me a cab straight to Heathrow for £45. I wasn't going to heathrow at all. Once I told her where I was going, she said get a taxi outside. Nice. Luckily, I only stayed a night. Would recommend going to travelodge more than this place, at least they have friendly staff. Just avoid this place altogether. A lot of 1/2* hotels are better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews before you book!”
Reviews.Author: krysus
Reviews.Content: We should have read the reviews - they are all correct. The rooms are fine, a bit dated, but there are a number of things that tainted our two night stay. 1) Shower in our (first) room had no cold water going into the mixer. 2) When we asked to shift rooms to one with a working shower, there was a lot of dicking about before we were offered an equivalent one. The guy on the front desk wasn't particularly interested or helpful. 3) The new room had working shower, except the door was falling off. 4) The toilet constantly dripped. 5) There was no hairdryer - although this was supplied when we asked. 6) The hot tap in the basin only dribbled. 7) The room is near the basement restaurant and we woke to the sound of crockery and cutlery clanging. 8) Didn't really affect us, but there is no lift, in a hotel with 5 levels. 9) Kettle and cups, but no tea or coffee - were told it's not provided. 10) Don't believe the pricing entered on wotif - the "regular" room rates are much lower than shown. There are plenty of similar hotels in the area. My advice would be to shop around.

Reviews.Title: “It is a shocker”
Reviews.Author: travellingbrits03
Reviews.Content: I normally leave a detailed review to try and help fellow travellers with an objective overview to help informed decisions. However, this hotel is a shocker - go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs - absolutely disgraceful!”
Reviews.Author: Glenys H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight in January 2012 due to hospital appointments and were looking forward to having somewhere good to relax. ...Absolutely disgusting, never a four star rating! Nothing good about it. Very tired dirty and run down. 84 steps including front steps to fourth floor bedroom number 3. No hot water, bulbs not working in bedside lamp or entrance to room. Telephone not working.Stair carpet filthly and stair rods broken. No tea/coffee despite kettle and cups provided. Breakfast was a laugh, only eggs offered for hot dish. No chair in room. No where to relax in the hotel. Supposed to be a half price deal but a big rip off. Health and safety ought to be on to this one!!! Nothing Opulent at all!

Reviews.Title: “Would rather be homeless”
Reviews.Author: Emily M
Reviews.Content: There isn't enough room on the internet to describe how awful this so-called 'hotel' was. The carpets were filthy, they had stained rooms, sleazy bathroom, greasy bed, garage sale furniture, rude staff and it was totally overpriced. I have stayed in much better backpacker hostels than this. It was also a very unpleasant experience for me personally as I had a very confronting situation where the staff gave away my room number to another hotel guest and I was cornered in my own hotel room! That was so dangerous and scary for me; it totally shook me up. To make matters worse, all the hotel manager did was shout back in my face and said he was at the shop at the time, so therefore it wasn't his responsibility. Despite this unprofessional manager, I had to call the police and report the incident. So I paid hundreds of pounds to stay in a filthy, unsafe and awful hotel with horribly rude staff. Oh, did I mention the breakfast wasn't even worth the walk down?

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience”
Reviews.Author: 892Mark
Reviews.Content: The other reviews cover most aspects and features of the hotel which I'm afraid are an accurate reflection of my stay. My unique experience was to share my room with a mouse which I must admit seemed to quite enjoy the some what tarnished facilities.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel and dont know why people hate this hotel though its a nice place to saty”
Reviews.Author: Mariaa434
Reviews.Content: This is fifth stay in opulence stay. I never felt to write review as I donâ€™t care this issues much. But when I was going through hotel reviews I make up my mind to write my experience of stay in opulence. First of all if this hotel was that bad I would not have been here for the fifth time. This time I was here for 5 nights n as soon as i was in the hotel the young reception guy welcomed me as we were quite familiar to eachother in my last stay. He gave me the room in third floor. The room was more better than last time I stayed(6 mths before). The room was clean, neat and tidy. I donâ€™t think most of the hotels provide molton brown stuffs which opulence does .There was wood in the room instead of carpet and bathrooms were more decorated. I was very happy with the room improvement. As I am a regular guest they offered me a senior suite for my last two days stay in the same price which was happily accepted by me. I was really happy with the rooms. The double room was good in its place but senior suite was much more amazing. I really enjoyed my trip. Though the timing for breakfast is late the breakfast served by the young always smiling chef was really good. The guest just next to me said in the room that she never had this type of good omelette in her life. I didnt tried the omelette but the fried egg was good too. For me opulence is the nice hotel whatever the reviews says. I will be coming back to opulence whenever I am in London for sure. Thank you for making my stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “squalor hotel”
Reviews.Author: max b
Reviews.Content: I'm 52.Ii go to conferences as part of my job and have stayed in hundreds (maybe thousands) of hotels over the past 30 years. I like books and hate the internet. I've never posted a review of anything in my life but I feel so animated about the Opulence Hotel that I feel I have to warn other unsuspecting travellers. FOR GOD'S SAKE DON'T BOOK IN THIS HELL-HOLE!!! Our room was tiny - enough for a double bed and nothing else. i had to crawl over my partner to get in and out of bed as the bed was against two walls and there was no room to get in my side. The sheet was a single sheet stretched so that it just covered the mattress area but didn't dangle down. The net curtain was beyond filthy, but as it was attached by a bit of velcro it was easy to take down and hide in the wardrobe. There was a kettle I admit, but no tea, coffee, milk or sugar. But that was alright because you couldn't fit the kettle under the bathroom tap in any case. Oh yes, the bathroom: this was a very small triangular corner of the room containing a miniscule shower which got to lukewarm after 5 minutes. The only cooked item for breakfast was eggs. We'd booked for 2 days but left after 1 and the staff refused to refund us any money, but we were so happy to leave I was actually laughing en route to the holiday Inn in Camden Lock, regardless of the money loss. This hotel should feature in the next "Silent Hill" game. Please don't stay here, you deserve so much better

Reviews.Title: “2 star guest house at best”
Reviews.Author: sooofy
Reviews.Content: Grubby, hot and absolutely no facilities or service. This is not a 4 star hotel..........AVOID!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality hotel with little regard for guest comfort”
Reviews.Author: Ben699
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights for work, was stuffed into a tiny, dirty room in the basement. Room was so hot I had to leave the window open to the street to keep cool enough to sleep, and was of course then constantly woken by passing buses, trucks and sirens. Awful, wouldn't kennel my dog there.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere--the hotel from hell !”
Reviews.Author: BadhotelYorkshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel,and,after one night of a two night stay we left !It was dirty,cluttered,with stained bedding.The dust in the room had obviously been there for sometime.It is one of the worst hotels we have ever stayed in.The cluttered reception upstairs(?) with badly trained staff is your first introduction to this ghastly hotel.It totally ruined our short stay in London.We went home feeling very disappointed and rather unclean.DO NOT waste your hard-earned cash on this hotel--GO ELSEWHERE even if you have to pay slightly more.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointing!”
Reviews.Author: matt g
Reviews.Content: Very narrow staircase. Smelled like curry when we walked in. Stains on all the pillows, carpets and comforters. Hot water did not work, shower head busted while we were there. No air conditioning. Only yogurt and toast for breakfast. Very expensive for what you get. We stayed one night, then found a much better hotel for the same price through Priceline. Don't waste your time with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “need to train to get up the stairs”
Reviews.Author: gaz14_11
Reviews.Content: i had read the reviews of this hotel before going and there was a lot of apprehension when we arrived has to what we were going to get.could have emptied the hotel of anything valuable because there was no one on the reception for quite some time after our arrival which is situated on the first floor which came has a surprise.anyway checked in fought to get upthe stairs to the very top anyway after getting my breath back managed to open the bedroom door .yes the room was small and there was a smell of fresh paint the room was small but not that small for a london hotel have stayed in a lot smaller and paid a lot more in the past the room was basic but clean and you could do what you needed to do in the bathroom mini bar was empty, and not plugged in there was a kettle and two cups but no complimentary tea or coffee which disapointed the bed was clean but to hard for my liking and an extra pillow would not have gone amiss.location is great and central to everything TIP take tea and coffee and aspoon with you and everthing else you might need has the trip up and down the stairs is awful. four stair rating is way over probably a 2 the price is right for the location and room type would stay again but not on the top floor one other thing the noise. the taps screech all night doors banging floors clatter when walked on if they do serve breakfast its well hid no smells of food anywhere and i dont no where you would eat it anyway.basically you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend staying in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caroline186600
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the internet description and pictures shown on website. However the standard of accommodation was no where near the standard of accommodation shown on website. In addition hotel advertised that it had air conditioning. However on checking in our room smelled musty and stale and there was no air conditioning. I went back to complain and and had very little satisfaction - we were advised that we could sleep that night with our window open in the centre of London - best they could do !! However the next night they would get us a portable air conditioning unit. We then looked for our money back and they would not give a refund. Overall experience was terrible - so much so I would go as far as it ruined our 3 night break in London.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive frontage belies interior”
Reviews.Author: flowerfairy2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last year but was only prompted to add this review now because I have been online looking for a decent place to spend another break in London and came across this same hotel, boasting the same claims as last year. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in and how it got a four star rating is a total mystery to me . My son booked a single room (via Booking.Com) for me in this hotel and a double room for my brother and his wife who were visiting from South Africa. It was booked on the strength of it being a four star hotel but it was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in and totally ruined our London visit. We found out too late that the Opulence website is a total load of codswallop. There is NO room service, NO tea making facilities, NO "in-room" spa (whatever that may be) and no way guests could get a drink, not even a cup of tea. There were no telephones in the rooms, and to speak to anyone at the "reception desk" you had to climb a flight of stairs if you were on the ground floor. The bedspread and cushion in my room was dirty and stained and the bathrobe had make-up on the front and the sleeve. When I complained I was told there was no housekeeper available until the next day. The bedspread was replaced the following day and the bathrobe removed but not replaced. The carpet was dirty and the curtains were tatty. The shower was filthy and brown round the outside and there was no glass for teeth cleaning in either room. We had to buy plastic cups! Breakfast was the worst meal I have ever had in a hotel and I have stayed in plenty! There was no full English available, bacon or sausage was a definite no-no. The "continental buffet" saw the same limp food put out two days on the trot. But there were eggs!! However, the "chef" did not know how long to boil them for so they were dished up like golf balls. There were no egg cups, so they were served on plates. This hotel has a very pleasant facade when viewed from the pavement and that is all it has to recommend it. If it really has four stars it makes the entire star rating system a farce. The stairs were filthy, and the stair carpet iwas old and worn, the paintwork was in a disgusting condition and the bedroom doors were dirty. The at Â£200 and Â£240 for two nights, the rooms were not cheap. . I would certainly never recommend anyone to stay there. It totally spoiled our London visit for us. I still have photographs showing how unbelieveably dirty the place was. I complained to Booking.com that its description of the hotel was misleading (especially the four star rating it gave), also to the Tourist Board and to Consumer Direct. Needless to say I got nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't spoil your holiday by staying here.”
Reviews.Author: Lynbar60
Reviews.Content: We travelled for three months around Europe and this hotel was the most expensive and the worst by far. The sheet on our bed finished at the mattress top edge (no tuck in). There was no room beside the bed to get out had to cross over the mattress. The shower tray nearly overflowed. We asked three times before they looked at it. No aircon and the rooms are very small and it got extremely hot. Our sons room in the basement below the road looked out onto full black rubbish bags. His room had no toilet paper or soap and there was a plastic wrapper in the shower drain and the glass in the bathroom had Toothpaste remains in it. There was a brass strip on the top of the stair step that had a screw missing and was loose. A dead Bonsai plant on the landing and one of the pot plants at the front door was dead. No attention to detail. Breakfast was not till 8.30. Their write up on Wotif (four stars), in their compendium and on the TV screen in the room was written by somebody who obviously had not been to the hotel! to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY DISCRACEFUL!”
Reviews.Author: ButterflyWarwick
Reviews.Content: This is lengthy because I do not want anyone else to be conned as I was into believing that this could possibly be a four star hotel. Even a one star would be too generous. I booked this hotel through Central R having read the wonderful blurb: 'The attention to detail, impeccable services & a passion for indulging their esteemed guests'. This is a classic case of gross misinterpretation! On entering the hotel the first thing I noticed was the dirty carpet on a staircase, the balustrade more chips out of the paintwork than there was paint. There was nothing else there, I then heard a voice say come up here. So I climbed up a staircase to a landing where the reception was more like a cupboard with a dirty silk flower arrangement sitting on a shelf (not even a desk more like a cubby hole). The first thing that I said to the male receptionist was 'I thought the hotel had been newly refurbished' his response was the rooms have been. Earlier in the week I had treatment for a back injury. After checking in the receptionist said he would take me to my room. Climbing three equally dirty, dark and shabby staircases I explained that I could not manage all these stairs due to by back problems. He then told me that I was on the fifth floor and there were two more flights to go! When I asked about a lift he responded that it was an Victorian building more like a home than a hotel! I then explained that it was impossible for me to stay here as I could not manage to go up and down five flights of stairs and that I would have to find somewhere else. He told me that I had to pay for the room as I had not given 48 hours notice of cancellation. I said that this was not a normal cancellation but the fact that I could not manage the stairs and that their website had been totally misleading. I then went outside and called Central R, the booking agent, who were very sympathetic and said I would not be charged for the hotel and would get a full refund if any charges were taken from my credit card. This was followed by an email confirmation that a refund would be given. Four weeks later Â£93 had been taken from my card by Opulence Hotel. Neither CentralR or Hotel Solutions can retrieve my money, saying that the hotel has a strict policy for cancellations! Though I have lost the money it was better than having to stay one night in such a discraseful hotel. Having just read previous 'shocking' reviews from other unlucky travellers I had a lucky escape!

Reviews.Title: “Only to be used if nothing else is available!”
Reviews.Author: ghe4c
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not a 4-star, a 2-star at the best. No lift, you carry your luggage to the 4th floor on a very narrow staircase, my mattress was battered, bed-covers weren't new, the corners of staircase and rooms were dirty, wallpaper peeling in some places, the breakfast is poor (cheapest cold cuts, toasts in smelly old wrappings...), and if you leave your luggage in "safe-keeping", it will stand all day near the exit, ready to be picked up by whoever wants to walk 3 meters from the door. To crown the experience: the hotel management tried to unbook me at the last minute, probably trying to sell the room at a higher price (London center was fully booked that week). This hotel is slowly run down, to be avoided if possible

Reviews.Title: “Awful !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SarahLongbottom
Reviews.Content: Absolutley rubbish!!!!! we booked this hotel because it was within a short walking distance to hyde park as we was attending a concert there and my boyfriend has trouble walking long distances due to when he broke his leg so we thought it would be easy walking distance without having to pay a fortune on taxis. We paid in full when we booked it and recieved a confirmation email. it was Â£145 all together for a double room. We was late arriving due to traffic problems so we knew we was going to miss the beginning of the concert. We arrived at the hotel at about 2.30pm. We went to check in and was informed that there had been an over booking and that we was now booked into a hotel in Victoria. The young male receptionist was useless. He said there was nothing he could do, he wouldnt give us the head office phone number or his managers name. He just said that the manager was away for the weekend. We asked how far away was Victoria and he showed us a map that didnt have it on there! After lots of complaining about how we should have been informed prior to our arrival, he agreed to pay for a taxi to the new hotel as that was the only compensation he could offer. He attempted to call the agency (Agoda) that we booked through but said that no-one was answering. I asked if the new hotel was the same company and he said yes and that it was the same star rating with the same room facilities. We arrived at the new hotel at about 3.30pm to find that it was a completley different company. The young female receptionist knew nothing about us being double booked at the original hotel. She called the agency and got straight through. We booked through Agoda but it turned out that our booking had now been passed onto a company called HDS (hotel direct solutions). The man on the phone said that he would have a look for something closer to hyde park but there was no joy. He said that they had done us a favour by finding us somewhere else. We asked the receptionist how much is a double room and she said Â£120 so we had in fact been downgraded to stay in an area that we didnt want to be in!! We had to stay with this hotel as we had no other choice. We had already paid for car parking for the 2 days in Wembley and paid Â£20 in a taxi to get to the original hotel and now we found that we could have parked at this hotel for free if only we had known. The hotel room was situated in another building down the road and was the smallest room ever. There was no in-room safe, fridge or tea/coffee facilities which we was expecting at the other one. We had to pay out Â£15 in a taxi to hyde park and then Â£30 in a taxi home at the end of the night when we should have been within walking distance. We are not impressed with how this was dealt with. If we had been informed prior to our arrival then we would have cancelled and rebooked somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie089
Reviews.Content: Whoever described this as 'Crapulence' in an earlier review was spot on. Unfortunately we had already booked before looking at the reviews, and were unable to cancel. Most of the reviews are negative, and we found out why: Wet pillow cases, dirty duvet cover, what appeared to be a blood stained toilet, ripped/shabby furnishings, generally dirty, disfunctional shower, hard bed and cheap foam pillows. Also there was a kettle and two mugs, but no coffee/tea to actually make a drink. The service was lacking and we didn't even bother having breakfast for fear of what we'd be served up. Truly 'crapulent'.

Reviews.Title: “The opposicomforte of Opulence!!”
Reviews.Author: louisemiriam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so NOT opulent it made us laugh. If they spent more on the towels and less on the pictures on the wall, it would be a much better hotel. The bathroom was very small, but water was hot and the shower was ok, but small. But they only supplied us with two handtowels. We rang down for 2 bathtowels, they sent one and another handtowel. We asked for another bathtowel, they sent us one with a large hole... The curtain was coming off the rail, it was all rather shabby. There was a kettle and 2 cups on a tray - we rang them to ask where the tea-bags were - they said they didn't provide them, the kettle was a facility! Clean enough, and we were at the back of the building so we slept ok. But basic and functional rather than comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The name must be ironic”
Reviews.Author: Sorensen86
Reviews.Content: I was sorely disappointed with this hotel. The location was quite convenient, as it was located near to the branch of my company that I was visiting, but that's the sole positive. There are no tea or coffee making facilities, but bizzarely, a rather large fridge. The room was cramped-- a smaller wardrobe would be a good investment. There is no restaurant at this hotel. I understand they do a breakfast, but there are no lunch/dinner/room service facilities. But those were mere annoyances considering the bathroom (including shower) were absolutely filthy. The young man at the desk (and I'm not being patronising-- he looked about 14) barely spoke English. I went down the street to the Hyatt for the directions I needed. I do not recommend this hotel, and will most definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: alison186408
Reviews.Content: As my partner had never been to London, I wanted to surprise him with a stay in a luxury hotel for his 30th birthday. Looking at the pictures on the hotel's website, I was very impressed with what I saw. It looked gorgeous, and, to be fair I took some photos myself while I was there and the room looked nice on these, too. There was a mix up with the rooms initally when we arrived as I had booked the superior room and we were given a very poky double, which the person behind the desk didnt even show us to, and we had to carry our suitcases up three flights of steps and where one of the curtains was falling down. After insistant complaining, we ended up with the superior room which was bigger and at a glance, far nicer. However, the curtains didn't close, there were foot-shaped stains on the carpet, it was damp and dirty, wallpaper was peeling off and one of the plug sockets was falling off, too. The hotel is NOTHING like it looks on the pictures, and there are no minibars, hairdryers or, in fact, any of the things it has listed on the website. I was very disappointed in the hotel and feel it is unfair for them to give the impression it is a luxury hotel when it quite clearly isn't and charge the prices they do for such a poor service.

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks!”
Reviews.Author: JDBishop5
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to get through to the front desk for over two hours without getting the hotel to answer its telephone. They finally answered, denied there was a problem, and then misconnected my call. Now, they don't answer again. You are better off staying in the Tower.

Reviews.Title: “A budget B&B - definitely not opulent!”
Reviews.Author: 4FamilyMan4
Reviews.Content: This should be classed as a budget B&B. When we stayed the whole place was being run by one guy. He manned the reception and also made the breakfast which consisted of coffee (no milk at first) and toast. Hotel Good Points: Location. Close to Marble Arch station and nice area. Rooms are acceptable in terms of cleanliness. Hotel Bad Points: Run down; rooms are tiny; shower is TINY!!; rooms are dark; whole hotel is dated and in need of decoration and updating; hotel (B&B) appears to be run by one single young bloke (polite but under-resourced).

Reviews.Title: “Losing reservations by the dozen”
Reviews.Author: ellesselux
Reviews.Content: I had an Expedia confirmation when I arrived at 11pm but the place was booked with no rooms. While I spend 90 mins on the phone with Expedia (great experience as well) standing in the lobby, 2 more guests showed up with the same problem. Isn't it impressive to have 3 people with confirmations and without rooms within about one hour? This place is a disaster - avoid at all cost. Same applies to Expedia assistance when needed. Relocated to a 2 star dump in the outskirts, now arguing with Expedia to get part of my money back. Takes hours on the phone with little progress...

Reviews.Title: “Broken down hotel”
Reviews.Author: GiantSimon
Reviews.Content: For just about every quaint detail listed on the description, assume it's broken, poorly implemented, or simply non-existent. Bait-and-switch advertising. June 2010. We stayed in one of the large Suites for 3 days. Glad we changed hotels for the balance of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience in my life”
Reviews.Author: javieranta
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a lot and had to stay 3 nights in this hotel since it was the only one near my office that was available at that time. My experience in this hotel was just terrible. Just to prove that I am not exaggerating, here are the facts: - No warm water for the 3 whole days! The cold showers were refreshing but definitely not pleasant - Part of the roof in the bathroom had fallen down - Courtains did not cover the whole window, so there was a lot of light coming from outside - Room was hot and there was no Air Conditioning - Room was way far from clean - Very noisy, you could hear absolutely everything: the cars outside, doors being closed in any floor of the hotel,... The worst came when the couple in the room above mine decided to have some "fun" at 12pm - Some lamps didn't work. When I asked in the reception to have this solved, they gave me a lightbulb so I would change it myself - Received several automatic telephone calls at 11pm to my room... no one was really calling, seemed to be a problem of the telephone switchboard - WiFi (not free) was extremely slow... unusable - There was no elevator in the hotel - Mandatory to pay in advance when you register, and you can't pay with American Express - The breakfast... when I saw it, I went directly to Costa Coffe to eat something decent - Last surprise was that when I wanted to do the checkout there was nobody there... 15 minutes after waiting somebody finally appeared

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN - THIS HOTEL IS THE WORST I'VE EVER STAYED IN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: anneeturner
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a week-end with my 2 friends. I'm sorry I didn't read the reviews before booking, but the photographs which had obviously been taken a long time ago portrayed a really nice place to stay. . I was put in room 16 a single room on the ground floor. The room was about 6 feet wide, 18 feet long and contained a small toilet/shower room, a single bed and a built in wardrobe with a small fridge inside. There was no room for a chair, the only sitting area was the bed. The paper was peeling off the walls, the bed covers were filthy and the net curtains were so dirty they were stiff and were falling off the tracks. The television had 5 terrestrial channels in English and the additional channels were in a foreign language. There was no remote control. The bedding and towels were clean, although I got some suspicious insect bites during the first night. There was no air conditioing, but a fan was provided. My friends were put into room 19, a double room in the basement. The room was like a sauna even when the window was opened, (it had to be propped open with the bin!). There was no air in the room and no air conditioning or fan. They repeatedly asked for a fan and were told that there were none available. In the end, they were so uncomfortable, I gave them my fan as my room was marginally more airy than theirs. Like in my room the bed covers were dirty, it was obviously they hadn't been washed for a long time and I don't think the nets had ever been washed !!! When they booked in they complained that they had been put in the basement and were told they could be moved the next day. When they requested a move the next day, they were told that they had agreed to stay in the basement, which was untrue. The hotel needs a good clean, especially the stairwells. The receptionist needs to learn some manners and to treat people who have paid to stay in the hotel with some respect. The young cleaner was polite and the chef was lovely, very helpful. The breakfast was adequate and he he did his best with the options available. The dining room was small and cramped - it could accomodate only 6 people comfortably. This hotel should be reported to environment health.

Reviews.Title: “Really not nice. Stay only as a last resort.”
Reviews.Author: RachnPaulR
Reviews.Content: We did not book this hotel, we actually booked at the Staunton but there was a mix up (despite booking 5 months in advance) and they re-booked us into the Opulence. Given a choice we wouldn't have come here. The Opulence is not a nice hotel. It has "kerb appeal" with an attractive door.....but that's where it ends. The public areas are at best tired, at worst shabby and dirty. The room was very warm with no air con, but we couldn't leave a window open due to traffic noise. There was no facilities to make a hot drink, no kettle, and the fittings were poor - ripped bedspread, stained cushions, cracked bathroom mirror, shower that wouldn't drain. Breakfast was revolting - my husband gave it 2 out of 10 and he usually eats anything! Cheap cereal (one variety), watered down orange juice and the cooked option??? - eggs (fried, scrambled, boiled, omelette). By that I mean thats all there was - eggs. The staff were mixed - the room cleaner was pleasant, as was the kitchen guy, but the Receptionist didn't even look up from her phone conversation when we checked out. That said, at least she was there on check out - when we had arrived there was no-one to be seen and despite ringing the bell 5 times, it took about 15 minutes for her to arrive. All in all, a poor experince which should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “They're definitely being ironic by calling this hotel Opulence.”
Reviews.Author: Kazanger
Reviews.Content: Peeling wallpaper, stained carpets, stained bed covers and cushions. Not exactly what you'd expect from a hotel that has the audacity to call itself the Opulence Hotel. The air conditioning consisted of a big lug of a machine which we had to move to the window so we could stick the pipe out to make it work. We then had to rearrange the furniture so we could actually plug it in. Also one of the plugs on the wall was broken, wires sticking out and all, these people must never have heard of a fire hazard. Not to mention what could happen if a child stuck his/her finger into it. When we complained about the room they offered us a suite. Talk about going from bad to worse. There was about ten bulbs gone, the net curtains were black and there was a big stain on the carpet. The hotel completely misrepresented itself on its website. Breakfast was included in our rate which we decided to skip because we felt there was a pretty good chance we'd be sick for the rest of the weekend. We moved out of the hotel after the first night, which couldn't come fast enough.

Reviews.Title: “Opulence - HOVEL not Hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: EKclassylassie
Reviews.Content: I organised a London trip for myself and three friends to celebrate one of the groupâ€™s 65th birthday.Due to a mix up over our booking, we were re-located to this hotel On arrival, we were allocated rooms 6 and 7, both on the third floor, reached by climbing several narrow, steep flights of stairs as there was no lift. It was an exhausting climb! My respectable, elderly friends only managed to reach their room by stopping midway and on one occasion climbing the last flight on all fours!! Whilst, room 6 was a twin, room 7 resembled a single room, albeit with a double bed. The hope of an additional single bed being put in the room did not materialise nor was there space even to accommodate such! There was only one bedside table and lamp, one bath robe and one pair of slippers â€“ hence our suspicion we were being crammed into a single room. Room 7 was stifling hot despite the window being opened wide and our request for a fan could not be met by the reception staff member â€“ (room 6 had an air-conditioning unit). We asked for hand towels as only bath towels had been provided- these never appeared until the following day. We also reported the television control unit was not working â€“this was not repaired during our stay! We could not make use of the safe as it had been left locked. We did pass on all these complaints to the manageress, Mona and to be fair, we then did get hand towels, a portable fan was provided, a security key for the safe was handed to us, but no action taken on the tv control unit. Our friends in room 6 were a little more fortunate as the facilities did work, although there was a broken socket (see pic) and the shower tray proved too slippery for one of the ladies The breakfast arrangements were slapdash â€“ self serve cereal, toast, juice and coffee, we were offered a hot breakfast of scrambled eggs, fried eggs or omelette. The breakfast room was cramped, grubby , with mis-matched crockery and cutlery!! There was also a worrying hole in the wall â€“ see associated pictures. On our last day, the â€˜chefâ€™ failed to appear so we had no choice but to literally help ourselves to milk and butter from the kitchen! A word of warning â€“ do not under any circumstances use the toilet next to the kitchen â€“ it is truly disgusting!! Overall, the hotel was in desperate need of a deep clean and refurbishment. The rooms were tired with peeling wallpaper, worn and stained carpets, grubby towels and sanitary ware. Despite some quality touches, for example memory foam pillows, one bath robe and slippers, Molton Brown toiletries and lots of artwork throughout, it felt more like a hostel than a hotel. We would NEVER stay again at this establishment and only did so rather than cancel a long planned birthday trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: HMarie16
Reviews.Content: I didn't listen to the other reviews and decided to try this hotel. Please don't make the same mistake. There is no lobby area, no elevator (and many floors) and the staircase is NARROW. But none of this matters compared to the condition of the actual hotel, which is VERY RUN DOWN. Really. Without exaggeration, here is what I saw: the wallpaper is literally falling apart; wall outlets are half there, half not; the pillows are stained; the curtains are dirty; the carpet needs replacing the most. The shower is very very small as is the entire bathroom. The bedspread they gave me was LITERALLY SHREDDED. When I mentioned it to the staff, they said they wouldn't replace it until the next day. Just don't do it...this hotel needs to be completely redone.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service ruined the experience”
Reviews.Author: paaluz
Reviews.Content: The first thing we were told when showing the hotel reservation confirmation to a local for directions was Â«The Opulence? Well, it's not going to be that...Â», and right they were. The hotel is centrally located on Gloucester street, near popular attractions such as Mme. Tussuad, Baker street, Marble arch and much more. Everything within walking distance. Our rooms were in the basement, mine facing the road as a traditional London basement apartment would be. The rooms were tiny and gaudy. As for cleanliness, the bath as a little bit under OK, and quite worn down. Towels were clean, but without the Â«freshÂ» feel one get at some hotels. Bed was bed bug free and OK for a couple of nights sleep. No amenities aside from soap, shampoo and conditioner. Empty mini fridge. TV with lots of middle eastern channels, basic British channels, TVE and some Italian channels, of varying signal quality. Internet is not included, expensive and very bad quality. For GBP 10 per 24 hrs (USD 15, EUR 12) you get the lousy connection and an invalid excuse. Supposedly, the signal quality was bad in the basement, but my wireless card reported strong wireless signal, yet very bad connection, suggesting the problem is with the main internet connection to the hotel. If you are dependent on internet connection in your hotel, stay away. As the room was pre-paid, they did not want to give me a reciept for the internet use (What?). After pressing them, I got a reciept, printed on paper randomly pulled from a stack of sheets. No signature, no stamp, no VAT number given. If my finance apartment don't approve of this, at least it's good for laughs. All in all, it is a good place if money is your only concern. The rooms are tired, but not downright dirty. My room (17) was very noisy during the night, with lots of traffic passing by and also the slamming of doors from the night manager who stayed in the next room over. We paid EUR 87 (USD 111 / GBP 74) per person, per night. That is not expensive at all for London, specially when considering the location. We did not eat in the restaurant, as there are many good options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for a Weekend”
Reviews.Author: SGko
Reviews.Content: Great location in the centre of London, vaery close to the main atractions. The staff helpful and freandly, got from them directions and advise on local restaurants & places to visit. Checkin was quick and easy. The room was clean ant tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel with Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: khamy
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The location is fantastic. The service staff are exceptionally well trained and work very hard. The service is excellent and not too fussy. The rooms are very clean and of a high standard. I wonâ€™t go into much details as it will spoil it for future guests but I would be shocked if anyone gave less than a rave review. The personal touch is what we have lost these days as we go about our daily business and do we really listen to what people need? The Opulence does and more. The food was fantastic and everyone was excellent - I will remember my stay forever

Reviews.Title: “Dont do it !!”
Reviews.Author: Guest0987654321
Reviews.Content: It is dirty and old. And the service is the worst i have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “The worst stay of the year award goes to "The Opulence Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: qsharif
Reviews.Content: Well, for starters, when i entered the hotel, i knew that this was going to be a bad experience. I had to wait almost an hour to be given my room although i had booked it online already and payed for it. After i was finally given the card to my room, i entered the room and it just finished where it started, the room was so small and conjusted that it was even hard to breath. i called up the agent through whom i booked the room and they spoke to the hotel and they gave me a bigger room. so i thought ok this might be alrite, but no, it just got worse. The bathrooms are really small, there was someones hair on the wall, probably sum1 shaved, there was hair on the shower door glass, the wallpaper was coming off, the window wouldnt stay up, the carpets were not clean, the tv channels were not at all clear, internet charges were way too expensive. no one answers the fone at the reception if u need anything. and no one is there most of the time. if you see the pictures and the reviews on the main website of the hotel, they are completely bull! pls try and avoid this hotel, they overcharge you, for the price i paid i could have stayed at a 5 star posh hotel

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dresm
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 2 nights B & B. First room offered was in the basement, door would only open half way as a chair was wedged behind it, decoration was tired and nasty stains on the carpets. Toilet didn't flush and waited for maintainance man to come and fix ......... he didn't arrive so demanded a refund as reception said there were no other rooms available. After a bit of ........"You WILL give me my money back", we were given "a suite", bigger room but nothing special but hey atleast the toilet flushed!! Funny how they conjured up another room when a refund was demanded! When this hotel was booked it listed "complimentary breakfast" ....... does that not mean breakfast is included?!....... Apparently not, we had to pay extra for breakfast in another hotel! Oh and don't expect complimentary tea making facilities in the room because you don't get that either!! The staff were beyond useless and apparently never heard the term "good customer service". On a positive note, the steps up to the hotel were very nice although; your not going to sleep there are you?!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adora82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located around most of the attractions I wanted to see. Staff were very helpful. Rooms decorations were beyond my imagination especially for the suite where I stayed. Chef serves good quality breakfast with abundant choice. Will certainly come again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews! Save your money and avoid this place.”
Reviews.Author: makkernz
Reviews.Content: After booking and paying for this hotel from viewing the nice pictures on multiple hotel websites, I thought I'd see how lovely other guests thought it was. My heart sank when I saw the reviews, but I had hope it wouldn't be all that bad. When we arrived, everything people had written about quickly became apparent - from the worn and dirty stairwell carpet, to the noise, cleanliness of the rooms and general feel of the place. I had booked us a 'Senior Suite' which while being of a good size with some nice furniture, had a very dirty and stained carpet floor, paint chipping off the roof, mouldy/ripped curtains and very bad quality reception on the televsion with primarily international channels (and not many of them). Things got worse when we attempted to go to sleep. Despite having a room not facing the street, we were kept up by a television next to our room and people talking/arguing above our room (at 1am!). I think the main problem here is the paper thin walls rather than the other guests! Positive comments - we were able to get into our room at 12pm and checked out the next day at 12pm, plus our luggage was kept for us while we spent the day on Oxford Street. The hotel is also very close to the Oxford Street and mutiple tube stations - but as previously mentioned the hotel next door is probably half the price and twice as good.

Reviews.Title: “way too expensive”
Reviews.Author: highlander1971
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 2.45pm and had to wait till 4.15pm until I could get to my room downstairs. That is after I've waited 15 mins until somebody turned up at reception. I called Opulence Hotels reservations and had the phone ringing in front of me at the reception desk. Nobody would turn up - for 15 mins. Then I've asked for a room away from the street and was given one downstairs facing the street. The curtains didn't work, the telly was broken, there was food from a previous guest in the fridge and the lamp on the bedside table was broken - it would only get hot when switched on. Rather dangerous I thought. There were stains on the quilt, on the daytime pillow as well as all over the carpet and on the towels. Most of them had holes in them too. The bathroom was very small and the sink is falling apart. The safe didn't work either. Though it says on the website that the hotel is affiliated (whatever they mean by this) with a gym, there was no option to use one. And they wanted to charge me GBP 10 a day for WiFi - though it says on the website that there is WiFi. Well, it doesn't say it's free - but c'mon! There are no kettles in the rooms. I've stayed for 4 nights and payed ca. GBP 300 which is imho way too expensive. I was able to change to another much nicer room for the remaining nights. This one was kind of all right but again, will stains all over the carpet, towels and daytime pillow. It seems that the management are very tight: I had to beg for additional shower gel. I would expect one every time. Body lotion was provided the first night only. Breakfast was ok with friendly staff. Beds were ok. Second room (though away from street) still noisy. I was able to sleep when the guests in the room above went to bed. The lamp on the ceiling would make so much noise whenever somebody walked around above. I've looked forward to my stay in this hotel but was very disappointed and will not stay there again. They trick you in by charging too much so you think they're somewhat superior. But in fact it's a run down place and you might just stay next door for half the price. I stay in London twice a year and this is one of the lousiest places I've been to. Did I mention the unfriendly receptionist?

Reviews.Title: “I'm pretty sure there was dried blood on my sheets...”
Reviews.Author: 260163sydney
Reviews.Content: We were staying there because it was our last two nights in London after 3 months of holidaying around Europe, so we splurged a bit on this 4 star hotel. We got there, with 3 suitcases/bags each and there was NO LIFT! Then, I had to find the concierge who was in a little box halfway up the stairs. She seemed fairly unhelpful, and rude, you'd think in a 4 star hotel, the staff would be happy to help, maybe even help you with your bags considering the lack of lift. Nope! Upon first glance the room is huge and well decorated, but then I found rubbish on the top shelf of the wardrobe, the safe didn't work, the phone didn't work, the was no hairdryer, there were only 3 beauty products in the bathroom, the shower was tiny and looked about 100 years old. It smelt like mould, and finally when we went to bed that night, I found that there were what looked like little speckles of dried blood on the sheets!!!! I tried to call reception, but of course the phone was broken. So I went to find someone, no one was there, it was just past 1am and reception was a ghost town. So I had to lay a towel over the stains but of course that barely worked, so I didn't sleep the entire night. Obviously someone has changed the sheets and seen the marks, and yet they still used them!!! The towels were ripped and torn and stained as well actually. The next day, before I went for the breakfast, I told someone and they said they would change the sheets when they cleaned the room. I had breakfast, the chef was lovely, very nice and cooked me an omlette, but the buffet was far from what you'd expect from a 4 star hotel, I've had better in 3 star. That night, the sheets hadn't been changed, and it looked like they'd just been turned over. Also, they promise something like over 20 TV channels, I found maybe 3 that were in English, and the pay TV didn't work, so no chance of watching a film, and there was no menu for room service. I checked out the next day and wanted to put my bags in luggage storage. I was told there was a door on the basement that led the baggage storage. I walked in, there was no security, or lock on the door, and it was a narrow little walkway filled with rubbish and a ladder and an old suitcase with nothing in it. Wonderful! When I went to retrieve my bags there was a huge pile of rubbish outside the door. The only thing helpful the reception did was get me a cheap cab to Heathrow, but I left a good 5 hours before my flight only because I was scared about leaving my bags in that room.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value”
Reviews.Author: sunshinesmiler2010
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this in a misguided valentines treat. He isn't from London and didn'T use trip advisor!!!!! The hotel says it's a 4 star but this is a 2 star at the absolute stretch. The shower didn't work properly and my boyfriend had to fix this as the hotel couldn't be bothered. I am so annoyed about how much it costs. He paid 250GBP for what was advertised as a suite. A suite it was not!! It was a large room but it was not a suite. Also he paid up front so we couldn't even check out and go somewhere else. I'm so annoyed he wasted so much money on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away STAY AWAY this is a filthy hole and not fit for habitation”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler64
Reviews.Content: I was recently in London on business and decide to take my partner/spouse with me and make it a bit of a midweek pre-shopping break. Booked this hotel over the internet on the strength of is web site and the fact it was on laterooms. We arrived at about 730pm and waited for 20 mins for someone to attend the reception desk, in the end I had to hunt through the hotel to locate a member of staff. The receptionist insisted that we had to pay for our stay in advance rather than just a pre-authorisation. She then issued us with our keys and told us where the room was located, no offer of help with bags or any intention of coming with us to show us our room. Once we got to our room I found out why, its was disgusting, the bathroom hadn't been cleaned in months, paper and paint peeling of the walls and ceiling everywhere as well as the heating not working. Even the wardrobe was broken, went I went to complain about the state of the room I then had to find the member of staff again. She apologised and immediately offered us another room, "great" I thought no ifs or buts just fix the problem. NO the second room was worse than the first with damp stains(i assume) over the ceiling, walls and carpets and still the same disgusting state of cleanliness just bigger and more mess. When we said this was no better she offered us a bigger room which was even in a worse state that the previous 2. It was at this point I demanded my money back so we could leave this took a further hour of arguing with someone describing himself as the manager . They refused to refund my credit card and in the end after threats of police involvement and legal action they scrabbled around and came up with a cash refund. If there is one thing that I could wish for it wouldn't be world peace it would be that no one ever has to stay in this flea pit.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: neveragain31
Reviews.Content: Filthy place, apparently now being used by London Council to house asylum seekers. I turned up with work colleague with the rooms pre paid by our company. Receptionist (in cupboard) insistant that rooms had not been paid for insisted on credit card for further payment! Left very swiftly and found alternative accomodation at Holiday Inn Regents park for a cheaper rate and a room where you felt safe to close your eyes. Definately a place to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: MrGover
Reviews.Content: I don't normally complain, but please don't go near this hotel. The customer service from this place is the worse I have ever encountered. I booked a room and then hours before my stay they cancelled on me on a very busy weekend, so finding another hotel at such short notice was difficult. But the worst was to come. Days later after looking at my bank statement I noticed that they had still charged me! An honest mistake I thought... But when I phoned them the rude staff (especially the manager) told me I was charged because I did not show, even thought they had cancelled on me! They refused to give me my money back. They told me I would have to speak to the booking agency or the go between Hotel Solutions. They refused to discuss the matter even when I explained that it was their mistake. In all my years (39) I have never experienced such poor customer service. Fortunately, after 2 months of haggling and endless phone calls and a word with Trading Standards Hotel Solutions kindly gave me my money back even though it wasn't there place to do so. The Opulence Hotel refused to acknowledge their mistake or refund me. It's not what the Opulence Hotel did to me but it's the way they did it that is so disgraceful! They were rude and arrogant. I've never heard anything positive about this place. It's a complete fiasco. If you've booked and still have time to change do so now, or you WILL REGRET IT!

Reviews.Title: “never ever be tempted to stay here”
Reviews.Author: mrspegers
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked last minute and the picture looked ok - oh how deceptive that picture was! The reception is a shack, in effect stuffed into a corner, it was a shambles. The carpets are filthy and stained and were not fitted - as a consequence the edges were all tattered. The trip to the room (god help you if you are at the top as we were) was via a staircase which was poorly maintained (wall-paper peeling off, water stains down the wall). The room was terrible. The carpet was again stained and poorly fitted. the bedding was a disgrace and I threw the top cover into the wardrobe, where it stayed. The net curtain was grey with filth. The shower leaked all over the floor and was crammed into a space that my husband could not turn round in. You could not get to the sink properly because it was so crammed. The television did have 25 channels, however 24 of them did not have a reception. If there is a fire and you are the top, make sure that you have made a will because you will never get out unless you use the net curtains to paracute out! The receptionist was there from dawn to dusk but we did our best not to wake him when we came back at 10am to find him snoring laying on top of his reception shack. I would not rely on him for security or any form of fire warning system. The best way to navigate the room is to back into the shower and then jump onto the bed to dry off - thereby avoiding the carpet! To top it off two pillows with no pillow cases. We were flabergastered at the place, however my heart went out to the two Americans behind me who had paid Â£231 to stay there !
